alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 3:57AM CST until February 04 at 12:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New Orleans LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Louisiana... Bogue Falaya River At Camp Covington affecting St. Tammany Parish. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Bogue Falaya River At Camp Covington. * WHEN...From early this morning to this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 45.0 feet, Water will encroach residential property in the vicinity of the gage. Residences on the east bank near the river will be threatened. Water will cover entrance driveways to property on the east bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 45.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM CST Friday was 45.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest at around 46.5 feet later this morning then begin falling. - Flood stage is 45.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 45.9 feet on 05/13/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
